title: flat-bottomed s, straight letters, very close together
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hsb_text_4725.png)

The letters are very plain and vertical, squashed together quite close, so the automatic online identifiers can't distinguish them. To my uneducated eye, the most distinctive feature is that the lower-case s appears to have a round top but a flat bottom. Unfortunately there are no uppercase letters or numerals in my sample.
author: GertSoB

comments.content: Hard to say, blurry, super tight tracking... It's obviously a geometric sans, similar to [Avant-Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde) or [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/futura). Feels "freebie" too. Some you might like: [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/century-gothic), [Champagne & Limousines](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.dafont.com/champagne-limousines.font), **[Geo Sans Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.dafont.com/geo-sans-light.font)** (possibly matching). Actually, many freebies that you could find [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130507/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=501)) would do the job.
